captions.text: Why do we need the dog?
lt's not the dog we need.

What did he say?
He said,
''An 'edge is an 'edge.

''He only chopped it down
'cause it spoilt his view.

Look, l appreciate your
position, Mr. Webley,

but you can't go around
chopping down other
people's hedges

Mr. Webley, l trust you have
a license for that firearm?

What do you mean
by ''this one''?

By the power
of Gray Skull.

Where on earth
did you get these?

Well, Mr. Webley,
this is an extremely
dangerous collection.

lt's a wonder nobody's
been hurt before.

No, it's iust
a lot ofjunk.

No, apparently it's
been deactivated. Over.

lt's not live.
It looks live.

comments.author: joshua white

comments.text:
I love this kind of story telling. Correct me if I'm wrong, but we're never 
told where these weapons actually came from except that the dude found 
them. So it's left up to us to fill in the blanks.
Like, maybe they were part of the NWA's armoury at one point and he 
stumbled upon them. The sea mine suggests that the NWA maybe raided them 
from some war museum or something. Or it could be anything, that's what 
makes it so neat to me.﻿
comments.author: StuartRW64

comments.text:
I know it's a comedy, but it's not entirely implausible. The US Army had 
dumps of weapons and ammunition stacked unattended all over some parts of 
Southern England just prior to D-Day. Besides which, members of the Home 
Guard had weapons in their houses and members of the armed forces brought 
home souvenirs. You still get random bits of ordnance turning up in sheds 
and outbuildings.

comments.author: Wiicubemaster

comments.text:
+Wanted4PwnRS There are British Firearms Officers  (two kinds)
*1. Armed response* - Response to emergencies with firearms that need 
urgent attention.
*2. Specialist Firearms* - Covert Ops, arrests, sting operations, hostage 
rescues, etc.

The primary weapons used by firearms officers in the UK are the HK MP5 
Carbine and the Glock 17 9mm handgun.
comments.author: Andrew De Jesus

comments.author: YoniIsrael

comments.text:
Anything above 2 is a lot of guns in most European countries.

Guns are mostly recreational or military here (either it's for recreational 
hunting in which case it's either those old-fashioned over-and-under or 
side-by-side shotguns or Remminton pattern Rifles, or it's range shooting 
in which case it's mostly .22LR guns). If you want an Armalite you need to 
join the army.
